column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Nobody wants to find out why a person 's troubled anymore ?
#Text=No.
#Text=They just want to see what the effects are and how things resolve ?
#Text=Yeah , and tell a good story , and have lots of different things going on between different kinds of armies , like 300 or whoever they are -- talk about medieval , 300 is before medieval .
#Text=I think you 'll see more stuff like that .

#Text=It is n't entirely to my taste , but the funny thing is , when I see all that kind of material , and then I go back and I look at the kinds of the things that have always attracted me , I realize that it 's really the same story over and over and over again .
#Text=Some troubled white male and his dick , and he 's trying to figure out what the fuck is going on in this life --
#Text=I mean , this is Philip Roth .
#Text=It gets you to the Philip Roth novels that he 's been currently writing , which are --
#Text=Which are critically acclaimed but not commercially successful .
#Text=Yeah , and they 're also complete dead ends .
#Text=I mean , they 're the most fucking depressing things -- I mean if you 're a Philip Roth fan like me , and you 've been reading them for years , it 's okay .
#Text=You get it .
#Text=This guy is in his seventies , he 's wearing a diaper , he ca n't get it up anymore .
#Text=. . .
#Text=[ Laughs ]
#Text=You know , but how is it -- how would anybody else be into that kind of shit ?
#Text=It 's so uninteresting .
#Text=Well , it 's been seen so many times that everyone knows where it 's going ; it gets to the point where you 're like , okay , what is this ? " Dejected Man " ?
#Text=Is this , " World Did n't Turn Out The Way You Thought It Would Man " ?
#Text=Yeah .
#Text=In the end , the stories become uninteresting because you know it 's going to be either a , b , c , or d that makes the conflict .
#Text=Which is it going to be ?
#Text=People tend to like to read things because they want their interest grabbed .
#Text=They do n't want to read a book like when they watch a horror movie , knowing what is right around the corner .
#Text=Yeah .
#Text=How is that person going to die ?
#Text=You know they 're going to die .
#Text=Are they going to be slashed across the throat ?
#Text=are they going to have a sword plunging through their stomach ?
#Text=are they going to be shot in the face ?
#Text=Yeah .
#Text=You know when you watch a horror movie the person 's going to die ; it 's just a question of how .
#Text=Yeah .
#Text=When you take that to a literary level , it starts becoming too formulaic , and people do n't care how .
